TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CompositeControlDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Extends design-time behavior for controls that implement the methods of the abstract class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner> can be used with other control types that implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.INamingContainer> interface. Otherwise <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner> functions similarly to its base class, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner>. For an example, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void CreateChildControls() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates the child controls of this control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner.CreateChildControls%2A> method is used to recreate the child controls in the associated control. It ensures that the control collection is created before creating the design-time markup.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the HTML that is used to represent the control at design time.
Docs.returns: The HTML that is used to represent the control at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about the overloads available for this method see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner>.
In this overridden method, the base implementation always creates the child controls on the associated control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.param: The , which is the control associated with this designer.
Docs.summary: Initializes the designer with the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The designer host calls <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> to initialize the component for design.
The base implementation will throw an exception if the associated control does not implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.INamingContainer> interface.
